name: src/salte-auth.js
Validation
description: Disable certain security validations if your provider doesn't support them.

properties.name: nonce
properties.description: Passing false will disable nonce validation, leaving you vulnerable to replay attacks.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Passing false will disable state validation, leaving you vulnerable to XSRF attacks.

properties.name: azp
properties.description: Passing false will disable azp validation.

properties.name: aud
properties.description: Passing false will disable aud validation.

name: RedirectURLs
description: Disable certain security validations if your provider doesn't support them.

properties.name: loginUrl
properties.description: The redirect url specified in your identity provider for logging in.

properties.name: logoutUrl
properties.description: The redirect url specified in your identity provider for logging out.

name: Config
description: The configuration for salte auth

properties.name: providerUrl
properties.description: The base url of your identity provider.

properties.name: responseType
properties.description: The response type to authenticate with.

properties.name: redirectUrl
properties.description: The redirect url specified in your identity provider.

properties.name: clientId
properties.description: The client id of your identity provider

properties.name: scope
properties.description: A list of space-delimited claims used to determine what user information is provided and what access is given. Most providers require 'openid'.

properties.name: routes
properties.description: A list of secured routes. If true is provided then all routes are secured.

properties.name: endpoints
properties.description: A list of secured endpoints.

properties.name: provider
properties.description: The identity provider you're using.

properties.name: loginType
properties.description: The automated login type to use.

properties.name: redirectLoginCallback
properties.description: A callback that is invoked when a redirect login fails or succeeds.

properties.name: storageType
properties.description: The Storage api to keep authenticate information stored in.

properties.name: validation
properties.description: Used to disable certain security validations if your provider doesn't support them.

properties.name: autoRefresh
properties.description: Automatically refreshes the users token upon switching tabs or one minute prior to expiration.

properties.name: autoRefreshBuffer
properties.description: A number of miliseconds before token expiration to refresh.

properties.name: queryParams
properties.description: A key-value set of additional query params to attached to the login request.

name: LoginConfig
description: The configuration for salte auth

properties.name: noPrompt
properties.description: Disables login prompts, this should only be used for token renewal!

properties.name: clear
properties.description: Whether to clear "all" profile information, only "errors", or nothing.

properties.name: events
properties.description: Whether events should be fired off if the login is successful or not.

name: SalteAuth
description: Authentication Controller

name: constructor
description: Sets up Salte Auth

name: $providers
description: The supported identity providers

name: $promises
description: The active authentication promises

name: $timeouts
description: The active authentication timeouts

name: $listeners
description: The registered listeners

name: $config
description: The configuration for salte auth

name: $utilities
description: Various utility functions for salte auth

name: profile
description: The user profile for salte auth

name: mixin
description: A mixin built for Web Components

name: $provider
description: Returns the configured provider

name: $accessTokenUrl
description: The authentication url to retrieve the access token

name: $loginUrl
description: The authentication url to retrieve the id token

params.name: refresh
params.description: Whether this request is intended to refresh the token.

return.description: the computed login url

name: $deauthorizeUrl
description: The url to logout of the configured provider

name: on
description: Listens for an event to be invoked.

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback that fires when the specified event occurs.

name: off
description: Deregister a callback previously registered.

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback that fires when the specified event occurs.

name: $fire
description: Fires off an event to a given set of listeners

params.name: error
params.description: The error tied to this event.

params.name: data
params.description: The data tied to this event.

name: loginWithIframe
description: Authenticates using the iframe-based OAuth flow.

params.name: config
params.description: Whether this request is intended to refresh the token.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we finish authenticating

name: loginWithPopup
description: Authenticates using the popup-based OAuth flow.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we finish authenticating

name: loginWithNewTab
description: Authenticates using the tab-based OAuth flow.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we finish authenticating

name: loginWithRedirect
description: Authenticates using the redirect-based OAuth flow.
examples: auth.loginWithRedirect(); // Don't bother with utilizing the promise here, it never resolves.

params.name: redirectUrl
params.description: override for the redirect url, by default this will try to redirect the user back where they started.

return.description: a promise intended to block future login attempts.

name: logoutWithIframe
description: Unauthenticates using the iframe-based OAuth flow.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we finish deauthenticating

name: logoutWithPopup
description: Unauthenticates using the popup-based OAuth flow.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we finish deauthenticating

name: logoutWithNewTab
description: Unauthenticates using the tab-based OAuth flow.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we finish deauthenticating

name: logoutWithRedirect
description: Logs the user out of their configured identity provider.

name: refreshToken
description: Refreshes the users tokens and renews their session.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we finish renewing the users tokens.

name: $$refreshToken
description: Registers a timeout that will automatically refresh the id token

name: retrieveAccessToken
description: Authenticates, requests the access token, and returns it if necessary.

return.description: a promise that resolves when we retrieve the access token

name: $$onRouteChanged
description: Checks if the current route is secured and authenticates the user if necessary

name: $$onVisibilityChanged
description: Disables automatic refresh of the token if the page is no longer visible

SalteAuthProfile
description: All the profile information associated with the current authentication session

name: constructor
description: Parses the current url for the authentication values

name: userInfo
description: The parsed user information from the id token

name: $parseParams
description: Checks for a hash / query params, parses it, and removes it.

name: $parse
description: Parse a key-value pair

name: idTokenExpired
description: Whether the ID Token has expired

return.description: true if the "id_token" has expired

name: accessTokenExpired
description: Whether the Access Token has expired

return.description: true if the "access_token" has expired

name: $tokenType
description:
The type of Access Token that was returned by the identity provider

null

return.description: the type of access token

name: $expiration
description:
The date and time that the access token will expire

null

return.description: the expiration time as unix timestamp

name: $accessToken
description:
The Access Token returned by the identity provider

null

return.description: the access token

name: $idToken
description:
The ID Token returned by the identity provider

null

return.description: the id token

name: code
description:
The Authorization Code returned by the identity provider

null

return.description: the authorization code

name: $state
description:
The authentication state returned by the identity provider

null

return.description: the state value

name: $localState
description:
The locally generate authentication state

null

return.description: the local state value

name: $error
description:
The error returned by the identity provider

null

return.description: the state value

name: $errorDescription
description:
The error description returned by the identity provider

null

return.description: a string that describes the error that occurred

name: $redirectUrl
description:
The url the user originated from before authentication occurred

null

return.description: The url the user originated from before authentication occurred

name: $nonce
description:
Parses the User Info from the ID Token

null

return.description: The User Info from the ID Token

name: $actions
description: Sets or Gets an action based on whether a action was passed.

params.name: state
params.description: The state this action is tied to.

return.description: Returns a string if an action wasn't provided.

name: $refreshUserInfo
description: Parses the User Info from the ID Token

params.name: idToken
params.description: the id token to update based off

name: $validate
description: Verifies that we were logged in successfully and that all security checks pass

params.name: accessTokenRequest
params.description: if the request we're validating was an access token request

return.description: the error message

name: $getItem
description: Saves a value to the Web Storage API

params.name: overrideStorageType
params.description: the name of the storageType to use

return.description: the storage value for the given key

name: $saveItem
description: Saves a value to the Web Storage API

params.name: value
params.description: The value to save, if this is undefined or null it will delete the key

params.name: overrideStorageType
params.description: the name of the storageType to use

name: $storage
description: Return the active Web Storage API

return.description: the storage api to save and pull values from

name: $$getStorage
description: Determines which Web Storage API to return using the name provided

params.name: storageType
params.description: the name of the storageType to use

return.description: the web storage api that matches the given string

name: $clear
description: Clears out all `salte.auth` values from localStorage, sessionStorage, and Cookies

params.name: withPrivates
params.description: whether we should also clear out the private values.

name: $clearErrors
description: Clears all `salte.auth` error values from localStorage

name: src/salte-auth.providers.js
Providers
description: A collection of overrides for specific Identity Providers

name: auth0
description: Provider for Auth0

name: azure
description: Provider for Azure's Active Directory

name: cognito
description: Provider for Amazon's Cognito

name: wso2
description: Provider for WSO2's API Gateway

name: okta
description: Provider for Okta

name: src/salte-auth.utilities.js
SalteAuthUtilities
description: Basic utilities to support the authentication flow

name: constructor
description: Wraps all XHR and Fetch (if available) requests to allow promise interceptors

name: createUrl
description: Creates a URL using a base url and a queryParams object

params.name: baseUrl
params.description: the base url to attach the queryParams to

params.name: queryParams
params.description: the queryParams to attach to the baseUrl

return.description: the url with the request queryParams

name: resolveUrl
description: Converts a url to an absolute url

params.name: path
params.description: the url path to resolve to an absolute url

return.description: the absolutely resolved url

name: checkForMatchingUrl
description: Checks if the given url matches any of the test urls

params.name: tests
params.description: The urls to match the test url against

return.description: true if the url matches one of the tests

name: isRouteSecure
description: Determines if the given route is a secured route

params.name: securedRoutes
params.description: a list of routes that require authentication

return.description: true if the route provided is a secured route

name: openPopup
description: Opens a popup window in the middle of the viewport

return.description: resolves when the popup is closed

name: openNewTab
description: Opens a new tab

return.description: resolves when the tab is closed

name: createIframe
description: Opens an iframe in the background

params.name: show
params.description: whether the iframe should be visible

params.name: timeout
params.description: duration to wait before rejecting the request

return.description: resolves when the iframe is closed

name: addXHRInterceptor
description: Adds a XMLHttpRequest interceptor

name: addFetchInterceptor
description: Adds a fetch interceptor

name: $iframe
description: Checks if the current window is an iframe

return.description: true if the current window is an iframe.

name: $popup
description: Determines if the current window is a popup window opened by salte auth

return.description: the window object

name: $hidden
description: Determines if the page is currently hidden

return.description: true if the page is hidden

name: $navigate
description: Navigates to the url provided.

content:
OAuth 2.0 for the masses!

Docs Demo

[![NPM Version][npm-version-image]][npm-url] [![NPM Downloads][npm-downloads-image]][npm-url] [![Travis][travis-ci-image]][travis-ci-url] [![Coveralls][coveralls-image]][coveralls-url] [![semantic-release][semantic-release-image]][semantic-release-url] [![Greenkeeper badge][greenkeeper-image]][greenkeeper-url]
## Supported Browsers _If a version isn't specified that means we test on the latest and greatest, however most versions of that browser should work._ - Chrome - Firefox - Safari 8+ (7.1 and below require a [Promise polyfill](#promise-polyfill)) - Edge - IE 10+ (Requires a [Promise polyfill](#promise-polyfill)) ## Promise Polyfill Here's a list of well known ES6 Promise implementations developed by the community! * [es6-promise](https://www.npmjs.com/package/es6-promise) * [native-promise-only](https://www.npmjs.com/package/native-promise-only) * [bluebird](https://www.npmjs.com/package/bluebird) **Any other ES6 Promise implementation will work as well!** ## Install You can install this package either with `npm` or with `bower`. ## npm ```sh $ npm install @salte-auth/salte-auth ``` Then add a ` ``` Or `require('@salte-auth/salte-auth')` from your code. ## bower ```sh $ bower install salte-auth/salte-auth ``` Then add a ` ``` ### HTML Imports (Polymer 1.x - 2.x) We also support HTML Imports: ```html ``` ## ES6 Usage ```js import { SalteAuth } from '@salte-auth/salte-auth'; // Configure SalteAuth with Auth0's url and client id. const auth = new SalteAuth({ providerUrl: 'https://salte-os.auth0.com', responseType: 'id_token', redirectUrl: location.origin, clientId: '9JTBXBREtckkFHTxTNBceewrnn7NeDd0', scope: 'openid', routes: [ 'http://localhost:8080/account' ], endpoints: [ 'https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/1' ], provider: 'auth0' }); // Display an iframe to the user that allows them to login auth.loginWithIframe(); ``` ## ES5 Usage ```html ... ``` ## Known Issues _These are issues that we know about, but don't have a clear fix for!_ **There are currently no known issues, thanks for checking!** ## Debugging Debug logging can be enabled by setting a `localStorage` variable of `debug` to `@salte-auth/salte-auth*`. ## Documentation [Click here to view the documentation!](https://salte-auth.github.io/salte-auth/) **Use private or undocumented methods at your own risk, as they will not require a major version bump when breaking changes are made!** ## Shoutouts - [Auth0](https://auth0.com/?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=gp&utm_campaign=oss) - For providing us with an open source tenant! [npm-version-image]: https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@salte-auth/salte-auth.svg?style=flat [npm-downloads-image]: https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/@salte-auth/salte-auth.svg?style=flat [npm-url]: https://npmjs.org/package/@salte-auth/salte-auth [travis-ci-image]: https://img.shields.io/travis/com/salte-auth/salte-auth/master.svg?style=flat [travis-ci-url]: https://travis-ci.com/salte-auth/salte-auth [coveralls-image]: https://img.shields.io/coveralls/salte-auth/salte-auth/master.svg [coveralls-url]: https://coveralls.io/github/salte-auth/salte-auth?branch=master [commitizen-image]: https://img.shields.io/badge/commitizen-friendly-brightgreen.svg [commitizen-url]: https://commitizen.github.io/cz-cli/ [semantic-release-url]: https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release [semantic-release-image]: https://img.shields.io/badge/%20%20%F0%9F%93%A6%F0%9F%9A%80-semantic--release-e10079.svg [greenkeeper-image]: https://badges.greenkeeper.io/salte-auth/salte-auth.svg [greenkeeper-url]: https://greenkeeper.io
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@salte-auth/salte-auth",
  "version": "2.14.2",
  "main": "dist/salte-auth.min.js",
  "description": "OAuth 2.0 for the masses!",
  "homepage": "https://github.com/salte-auth/salte-auth",
  "bugs": "https://github.com/salte-auth/salte-auth/issues",
  "contributors": [
    "Nick Woodward <nick@salte.io>",
    "Dave Woodward <dave@salte.io>"
  ],
  "keywords": [
    "salte-auth",
    "oauth",
    "2.0",
    "authentication"
  ],
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/salte-auth/salte-auth.git"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "nps"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.5.5",
    "@babel/polyfill": "^7.2.5",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.5.5",
    "@polymer/polymer": "^3.1.0",
    "@semantic-release/exec": "^3.0.2",
    "@semantic-release/git": "^7.0.2",
    "@webcomponents/webcomponentsjs": "^2.0.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^10.0.3",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.0",
    "base64url": "^3.0.1",
    "chai": "^4.0.0",
    "coveralls": "^3.0.6",
    "cross-env": "^6.0.0",
    "debug": "^4.0.0",
    "deindent": "^0.1.0",
    "diff": "^4.0.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.3",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-member-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-plugin-require-coverage": "^0.1.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^6.0.0",
    "eslint-config-google": "^0.14.0",
    "eslint-plugin-compat": "^3.3.0",
    "eslint-plugin-mocha": "^6.1.1",
    "html-loader": "^0.5.1",
    "http-server": "^0.11.0",
    "husky": "^3.0.5",
    "istanbul-instrumenter-loader": "^3.0.0",
    "js-cookie": "^2.2.1",
    "karma": "^4.3.0",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "^3.0.0",
    "karma-coverage": "^2.0.0",
    "karma-mocha": "^1.3.0",
    "karma-mocha-reporter": "^2.2.5",
    "karma-sauce-launcher": "^2.0.0",
    "karma-sinon": "^1.0.0",
    "karma-sourcemap-loader": "^0.3.7",
    "karma-webpack": "^4.0.2",
    "lit-element": "^2.1.0",
    "lodash": "^4.17.15",
    "mocha": "^6.2.0",
    "moment": "^2.22.1",
    "nps": "^5.9.8",
    "promise-polyfill": "^8.1.0",
    "remove-lockfiles": "^2.0.0",
    "semantic-release": "^15.0.0",
    "sinon": "^7.4.1",
    "url-polyfill": "^1.1.7",
    "uuid": "^3.3.3",
    "watch": "^1.0.2",
    "webpack": "^4.29.5",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.2.3",
    "webpack-dev-server": "^3.2.1",
    "whatwg-fetch": "^3.0.0",
    "yargs": "^14.0.0"
  },
  "publishConfig": {
    "access": "public"
  },
  "husky": {
    "hooks": {
      "pre-commit": "remove-lockfiles"
    }
  },
  "browserslist": [
    "last 2 chrome versions",
    "last 2 firefox versions",
    "last 2 edge versions",
    "IE >= 10",
    "Safari >= 7"
  ]
}
name: package.json
